cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 miles SSE of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest to north-northwest and forecast to approach and make landfall along the central Texas coast, then drift inland across Texas with remnants eventually lifting toward Louisiana/Mississippi early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Port O’Connor–Corpus Christi

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches from Port Mansfield TX to High Island TX; tropical-storm watch Mouth of Rio Grande to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect with this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass with effects spreading into southwest Louisiana; outer rain bands and surf expected along remainder of Gulf coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds; breezy conditions possible late weekend/early next week
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Pascagoula based on current track; surge focus remains along Texas coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could deliver 3–6 inches of rain with locally higher totals, creating localized flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and rip currents along Mississippi‐Alabama barrier islands beginning this weekend
